intro: Hieracium pisaturense, commonly known as the Pisa thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open landscapes such as fields and coastal areas. It features spiny leaves and a yellow-orange flower head that develops into a tuft of white bristles. Hieracium pisaturense is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
